My research takes a human-centred view on AI-infused technologies to understand and support human activities and reasoning. My research is frequently concerned with how interactive technology can be designed to support collocated people interacting face-to-face. My research approach is multidisciplinary, drawing on ethnography, participatory design, prototyping, and studies of technology deployments, often with an ethnomethodological and conversation analytic lens.
